e4: Switching to the new, unbiased policy enhances transparency and aligns with ethical standards, potentially averting regulatory scrutiny. Though some investors might adjust reported values, ensuring consistent truthful reporting ultimately builds long-term investor trust and discourages sophisticated investors’ manipulation. It aligns company actions with transparent financial reporting principles, promoting fairer market practices.
e5: An ethical reporting policy should uphold accuracy, transparency, and fairness, thoroughly disclosing all relevant data without hiding intent or details, avoiding misleading clues, overt distortions, or withholding facts with misleading outside assumptions.
